2.21.21  2:16 pm   according to the information on this page writing things down is very important, but i don't do it. i don't know where to do it, and i'm scared of what i might find if i really think

      it might not be right for you. if it is right, you will probably know it immediately when you do it. If it's not right for you, then, something else may be right for you. it could be something i don't even know about

      how easy it is. this can be scary if you want it really bad

     yes

      that moment when the out crowd suddenly becomes the in crowd

      feeling is the theory. try to maximize the feeling. that is the theory that i always adhere to

      i will be discussing it with my team

      sure

      this may seem counter-intuitive, but, you're gonna have to go ahead and write something

2.21.21  1:35 am   is there any significance to the 8-ish seconds of white silence near the beginning of hotewig ?

     yes

      if so, what is it ?

     i'm trying to convey the feeling of what life is like when time (and therefore space) does not exist. Really trying to build up a motivational case for doing the 'big bang', as scientists call it. Really trying to make you understand that you probably would have done the same thing, in that situation

2.20.21  11:38 pm   hello. do you create music for enjoyment?

      yes, but i also take enjoyment very very seriously

2.20.21  10:48 pm   how do I be a genius

      put your pants on both legs at the same time

2.20.21  9:56 pm   do you use people's questions as a randomness generator or is your randomness generator better?

      i actually use the questions as a source of stability, and predictability

2.20.21  9:27 pm   Are you a human?

      oh that would explain some of these outlandish feelings

2.20.21  8:24 pm   Do all of your songs have meaning to them?

     i'd say so

      Even your silly ones that SEEM to not make sense?

     you'd have to clarify which ones you think that is

2.20.21  7:19 pm   do you prefer the making the music parts of your videos or animating them?

      the real power move, i've found, is to do both

2.20.21  6:46 pm   There are more periods than i am used to seeing you type in the music video for "here comes the sun". What about the song made you feel the need to type more periods?

      nothing. i'm not convinced that your hypothesis here is even true at all

2.20.21  5:40 pm   any advice for beginner musicians?

      let me know if anything has gone wrong yet. if nothing has gone wrong, then it wouldn't be appropriate for me to give you any advice yet

2.20.21  5:36 pm   Is is ok to be weird?

      sometimes it's required, just to get by

2.20.21  5:10 pm   In " at the airport terminal ". Do you lick the terminal floor?

      no

2.20.21  4:51 pm   I struggle between choosing to spend my time coming up with new ideas or finish existing ones that I started. I want to have a goal of 1 new musical idea per *reasonable amount of time*, but I don't know how to prioritize between investing time into new things when I have ideas outstanding that need attention. Do you have any suggestions/have you experienced this? thanks

      basically what i did, when i was first in your situation, is to just keep coming up with new ideas. let them pile up. This is probably because i may have had a fear of not having enough ideas. Then it rapidly became a problem. Another thing i began doing is writing songs entirely on paper, and i would demand to finish the whole thing in 1 session. That's one way of dealing with it. so i wrote more and more and more. Sometimes they wouldn't get finished, sometimes they would. Usually if it was shorter, it would get finished. but they all got put into the list regardless. more years went by with more writing like this. It was more rare that i would ever record any of them. Eventually when the problem became even more serious, i finally found a way to work on the existing ideas. This is a whole separate task from generating new ideas, and i still consider them separate. For a couple years i ONLY did 'middle writing', which is where i work on existing ideas. Then a few months later, as i was getting ready to start recording some of them, i did a few weeks of finishing, just finishing writing for songs. I could talk for years about the different systems i've used for SELECTING which ones to work on. And this is not even to discuss selections for the recording process, which you didn't ask about. Eventually as enough years go by, you start to feel your life running out, so you probably take drastic measures. Nowadays, for me this is how it works: new ideas can come any time, that's always true. Sometimes they even come in dreams. So i catch them whenever they arrive, and i don't really do a writing session at that time because it's usually not the right time. but you just try to catch as much as you can. That's totally separate from any writing process or work process. Separately from that, it is a linear process of working toward the item i am releasing next, and i work on that 1 item until it's done. For songs, first what i do, at the beginning of a project, i do a round of new song idea generation, but this is NOT necessarily promising that any of these will be the one that's used. This is just to ensure that i am giving myself a chance to generate new ideas, which might have a chance of getting picked. So i generate some new ideas, maybe 10 or 15. Sometimes i use various different methods, just to make sure i've given myself a chance to try various things. Then, when that's done, i do song 'selection', which is where i'm going to choose which one is going to be recorded, for the next release. This selection is made from the ENTIRE list, which includes the new ones but also includes all the other ones, which are all at various levels of completion (writing). Once a selection is made, then it's quite simple. I finish the writing all the way, first, then record it, all the way. then make the video, all the way. I should clarify that this procedure didn't become solidified until after many many many years of ambiguity which may be similar to what you are going through now

2.20.21  4:41 pm   is cheese real

      it sure seems that way doesn't it

2.20.21  4:31 pm   how do you become more confident with something that you made?

      you have 2 options. make it better, or, convince yourself that you did the best anyone could have done in your situation

2.20.21  3:46 pm   How big is the earth?

      big enough for a romantic dinner date

2.20.21  3:40 pm   in a previous question someone theorised that the meaning of "here comes the sun" is "having hope when everything seems horrible, because it'll get better eventually, giving you joy and love" and you said "pretty much".
what i'm wondering is if the message of "here comes the sun" (what was stated above) is something personal to you?

     yes, but it also applies to absolutely everyone. even other animals and plants too. essentially anyone who has ever lived on our planet

     perhaps from the time you wrote the song or when you chose to make it into a full music video or if it's just a more general message? (of course if it is something really personal you don't have to say)

     the message is something like "ever had a bad time? well i have great news, the sun still exists and you will likely see it tomorrow morning"
